授業目的: The sub-title of the course: Western Powers in the Indo-Pacific.
特記事項: 本授業科目は、“オンライン授業60単位制限対象科目”ではありません。 The course is not subject to the 60-credit limit for online courses.
授業の概要・背景: The course directly deals with policy-relevant issues. The students are encouraged to follow credible news sources on Indo-Pacific security affairs on a daily basis, in order to cultivate their literacy on the topic.
授業方法: This course combines two formats: lectures (Session 1-4) and seminars (Session 5-12). The seminar is the more important component of the two.  In every session, the students are to have completed the assigned reading materials before coming to class.  In the seminars, each session (a) will start with a brief lecture by the instructor, (b) followed by individual student presentations (no group presentations) on the designated country’s strategy document, and (c) will end with class discussion.  Active student participation is expected.  The grading components will be explained in detail in Session 1.

第1回: The introduction and organization session.  The instructor lectures on key concepts and institutions in the field of Indo-Pacific security affairs. Sessions 1-4 are designed to set up a framework and provide the students with key background information. All the 14 sessions will be face-to-face (in-person) sessions.
